RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the route: U.S. Highway 59 and Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and U.S. Highway 359

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 59: a highway where Agent Trevino was inspecting vehicles, near the Freer immigration checkpoint, intersecting with Farm-to-Market Road 2050 to the west of Freer immigration checkpoint, used to avoid checkpoints, has a checkpoint that vehicles pass through
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: a road adjacent to the Border Patrol station parking lot, connected to U.S. 59, where vehicles drop off illegal aliens between the Freer immigration checkpoint and Bruni, and a point where aliens walk east to Highway 16, part of a route avoiding checkpoints via FM 2050, U.S. 59, and U.S. 359, used by ranchers, oilfield trucks, and utility trucks, and where Agent Jorge Luis Trevino followed the vehicles, has nearby ranches and oil fields, a connection between U.S. 359 and U.S. 59
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: route where picked-up aliens are taken after walking from Farm-to-Market Road 2050, allowing access to Houston or San Antonio to the north
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 359: road intersecting with Farm-to-Market Road 2050 to the east of the Hebbronville checkpoint, used to avoid checkpoints, one of the roads connected by Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 59 and Farm-to-Market Road: routes used to avoid checkpoints via FM 2050, U.S. 59, and U.S. 359
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 35: the most direct route to Dallas, Texas or San Antonio
